attributes.description: Specifies the overall positional accuracy achieved by integrating multi-sensor data, ensuring precise flight navigation.
attributes.name: positionalAccuracy

attributes.description: Data update frequency ensuring real-time sensor fusion and control responsiveness during flight operations.
attributes.name: dataUpdateRate

attributes.description: Level of redundancy provided through dual-system backup and failover mechanisms to ensure system reliability.
attributes.name: redundancyLevel

attributes.description: Communication frequency bands used for GNSS signals and external data links, guaranteeing robust data reception.
attributes.name: communicationFrequencies
attributes.value: L1 C/A, L2C for GNSS; VHF Data Link for telemetry

attributes.description: Maximum system latency measured from sensor input to command output to ensure timely navigational decisions.
attributes.name: systemLatency

designScenario.description: Develop an advanced Navigation System that leverages state-of-the-art multi-sensor fusion technology, incorporating Global Navigation Satellite System (GNSS), Inertial Navigation System (INS), and Real-Time Kinematic (RTK) corrections. The system is designed for modern aircraft, emphasizing high accuracy, rapid data processing, and robust fail-safe mechanisms to meet both operational and safety standards. This design facilitates precise route calculation, dynamic trajectory adjustments, and seamless communication with external data sources.
designScenario.name: Navigation System

details.description: The system must integrate data from GNSS, INS, and RTK modules to achieve continuous, real-time aircraft positioning.
Enable dynamic route recalculations using live meteorological and aeronautical data.
Achieve a data processing update rate of 20 Hz with a system latency not exceeding 50 milliseconds.
Ensure accurate position tracking with a maximum error margin of ±2 meters.
Implement dual redundant systems with automatic failover to safeguard against sensor or module failures.
Provide self-check routines and emergency alert features in case of data discrepancies.
Design an intuitive pilot interface with synthetic vision and touch controls, ensuring minimal distraction and ease of operation.
Streamline maintenance procedures with embedded diagnostics and remote troubleshooting capabilities.

relationships.description: The Flight Navigation Computer aggregates sensor data from both the GNSS Receiver Unit and the Inertial Navigation Unit for comprehensive data fusion.
The Flight Navigation Computer aggregates inertial data from the Inertial Navigation Unit to support dead reckoning and supplementary positioning.
The Flight Navigation Computer integrates correction data from the RTK Correction Module to refine positioning accuracy.
The Flight Navigation Computer depends on the Digital Map and Terrain Database for updated aeronautical and geographic data required for route planning.
The External Communications Interface is composed within the Flight Navigation Computer, facilitating external data exchange and software updates.
The Pilot Display Interface is associated with the Flight Navigation Computer to visualize navigation data and alerts for the flight crew.

systemComponents.description: Central processing unit that fuses multi-sensor data, computes flight paths, and controls navigation outputs.
systemComponents.name: Flight Navigation Computer

subComponents.description: Dedicated data fusion engine responsible for real-time integration of sensor inputs.
subComponents.name: Data Fusion Engine

subComponents.description: High-performance computation unit executing complex navigational algorithms.
subComponents.name: Computation Unit

systemComponents.description: Receives and processes satellite signals to provide primary positioning data.
systemComponents.name: GNSS Receiver Unit

subComponents.description: Multi-band GNSS antenna designed for optimal signal acquisition.
subComponents.name: GNSS Antenna

subComponents.description: Signal demodulator converting raw satellite data into digital information.
subComponents.name: Signal Demodulator

systemComponents.description: Captures inertial data through advanced MEMS sensors to supplement satellite navigation.
systemComponents.name: Inertial Navigation Unit

subComponents.description: High-precision MEMS accelerometers measuring linear movements.
subComponents.name: MEMS Accelerometer

subComponents.description: MEMS gyroscopes capturing angular rotations to enhance inertial measurements.
subComponents.name: MEMS Gyroscope

systemComponents.description: Processes correction signals received in real-time to enhance the accuracy of positional data.
systemComponents.name: RTK Correction Module

subComponents.description: Data link transceiver that receives RTK correction streams from ground stations or satellites.
subComponents.name: Data Link Transceiver

systemComponents.description: Maintains a comprehensive digital database of aeronautical charts, terrain, and obstacles for navigation computations.
systemComponents.name: Digital Map and Terrain Database

systemComponents.description: Facilitates external communications, receiving updates such as weather and air traffic advisories.
systemComponents.name: External Communications Interface

subComponents.description: VHF Data Link module for real-time transmission of aeronautical messages.
subComponents.name: VHF Data Link

subComponents.description: Satcom module providing satellite-based connectivity for remote updates.
subComponents.name: Satcom Module

systemComponents.description: Displays navigational data, synthetic vision, and system alerts in a pilot-friendly format for enhanced situational awareness.
systemComponents.name: Pilot Display Interface

subComponents.description: Synthetic Vision Display offering a 3D representation of the terrain and flight path.
subComponents.name: Synthetic Vision Display

subComponents.description: Multi-function touch controller for interactive system management.
subComponents.name: Touch Controller

dependencies.name: RFID Integration Requirement to RFID Unit

requirements.name: Signal Accuracy Requirement
requirements.text: The system shall achieve satellite signal acquisition with an accuracy within 5 meters.

requirements.name: Real-Time Positioning Requirement
requirements.text: The GPS system must provide real-time positioning updates at a minimum rate of 1 Hz.

requirements.name: RFID Integration Requirement
requirements.text: The system shall integrate RFID data for enhanced tracking and identification in aircraft navigation.

rag_context: The GPS System consists of various components such as the Backup GPS Module, Navigation System, GPS Antenna, GPS Receiver Module, and RFID GPS Integration Unit. Each component has specific attributes and design scenarios tailored to ensure precise satellite signal acquisition, real-time positioning, redundancy protocols, and seamless integration for accurate tracking and identification data in aircraft navigation systems.
